articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Nepalese President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Nepalese President
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Bidya Devi Bhandari, president of Nepal, on its national day.
					 Kim in the message wished the Nepalese president and people success in their work, expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative ties between the two countries would grow stronger in various fields.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Leaves for 72nd UN General Assembly
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves for 72nd UN General Assembly
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK led by Foreign Minister Ri Yong Ho left here Tuesday to attend the 72nd UN General Assembly.

articles.title: Cuban Ambassador Gives Reception
articles.content:
Cuban Ambassador Gives Reception
Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Cuban Ambassador to the DPRK Jesus De Los Angeles Aise Sotolongo gave a reception at the embassy on Tuesday to celebrate the 69th anniversary of the DPRK.
					Present there on invitation were Kim Yong Dae, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission who is chairman of the Korean Committee for Solidarity with Cuba, Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and officials concerned.
					
					Jesus De Los Angeles Aise Sotolongo said at the reception that the DPRK is demonstrating its dignity as a prosperous and powerful socialist country under the dynamic and seasoned guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					The Korean people's life is improving day by day despite the unreasonable UNSC's sanctions, he noted, adding that Cuba will always stand by the DPRK despite difficulties and trials and support the Korean people in their cause of justice.
					
					Kim Yong Dae in his speech noted that the peoples of the two countries have supported and cooperated with each other in the common struggle for socialism against imperialism and the U.S. and created the sincerest and durable history of friendship.
					
					He said that the Korean people would as ever extend full support and solidarity to the struggle of the fraternal Cuban people to frustrate the U.S. vicious moves against Cuba, reliably defend the gains of socialism and carry through the decision of the 7th Party Congress.

articles.title: 13th Pyongyang Autumn Int'l Trade Fair to Be Held
articles.content:
13th Pyongyang Autumn Int'l Trade Fair to Be Held
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The 13th Pyongyang Autumn International Trade Fair is to be held at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House from September 25 to 28.
					 More than 250 companies will take part in the fair, including those from the DPRK, Syria, China, Cuba, Iran, Italy, Indonesia, Vietnam and Taipei of China.
					
					 Presented to the fair will be products and goods made with the application of ultra-modern science and technology. The fair will be conducive to developing friendship, exchange and economic cooperation among countries.

articles.title: Second-Day Events of Taekwon-Do World Championships
articles.content:
Second-Day Events of Taekwon-Do World Championships
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The 20th Taekwon-Do World Championships are going on before full houses at the Taekwon-Do Hall.
					 Men's and women's individual sparring matches of various weights and special techniques competition took place on Tuesday.
					
					 The players showed impressive scenes by organically combining attack and defence with such diverse striking techniques as turning kick and fist punch.
					
					 The following are the results of the first-day events of the championships held on Monday:
						
					
					 Men's individual pattern 1st Degree;
					
					1. Han Hyok Bom (DPRK)
					
					2. Rim Wi Sok (DPRK)
					
					3. Aleksandr Bodrov (Russia), Vladislav Zarov (Estonia)
						
					
					 Men's individual pattern 2nd Degree
					
					1. Kim Chol Hak (DPRK)
					
					2. Kim Kwang Chon (DPRK)
					
					3. Lyubomir Bakalski (Bulgaria), Stanislav Usikov (Russia)
						
					
					 Men's individual pattern 3rd Degree
					
					1. Han Tae Bom (DPRK)
					
					2. Ivan Efimov (Russia)
					
					3. Sergei Shcherbenev (Russia), Wang Chao (China)
						
					
					 Men's individual pattern 4th Degree
					
					1. Kim Nam Su (DPRK)
					
					2. Pal Chivorn (Cambodia) 
					
					3. Shen Zhenzhe (China), Miljan Cosic (Bosnia and Herzegovina)
						
					
					 Women's individual pattern 1st Degree
					
					1. Yuliya Sredniakova (Russia)
					
					2. Pae Kyong Sim (DPRK)
					
					3. Tong Jing (China), Pravdova Kristyna (Czech Republic)
					
					
					
					 Women's individual pattern 2nd Degree
					
					1. Ri Un Jong (DPRK)
					
					2. Zhang Lele (China)
					
					3. Charlotte Jayne Nickson (Wales), Olga Borisenko (Estonia)
						
					
					 Women's individual pattern 3rd Degree
					
					1. Kim Hyang Sim (DPRK) 
					
					2. Anna Tishchenko (Russia)
					
					3. Kopecka Martina (Czech Republic), Valentina Iotchkova (England) 
						
					
					 Women's individual pattern 4th Degree
					
					1. Kim Ji Hyang (DPRK)
					
					2. Jenine Hutchinson (England)
					
					3. Maria Klochkova (Russia), Albena Sitnilska (Bulgaria)
					
					 
					
					 Men's team pattern 
					
					1. DPRK
					
					2. Russia 
					
					3. Ukraine, India 
						
					
					 Women's team pattern
					
					1. DPRK
					
					2. Russia
					
					3. Czech Republic, China

articles.title: National Workshop on World Ozone Day Held
articles.content:
National Workshop on World Ozone Day Held
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- A national workshop on World Ozone Day took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Tuesday.
					 Present there were officials of the State Planning Commission, the Ministry of Land and Environment Protection, and other committees, ministries, national institutions, science study organs and relevant units and the UN resident coordinator who doubles as UNDP resident representative here.
					
					 The reporter said that to protect ozone layer of the earth is the important work for human life and future.
					
					 The reporter stressed the need for all countries to cooperate and take joint actions to withdraw ozone layer depleting materials, saying the workshop would be conducive to increasing social interest in the protection of ozone layer.
					
					 Then speeches were made.
					
					 The participants in the workshop looked round pictures showing the effect of ozone layer depletion on existence of human beings and its protection activities before enjoying a video.

articles.title: Exhibition of Successes in Natural Energy Opens
articles.content:
Exhibition of Successes in Natural Energy Opens
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- A national exhibition of sci-tech achievements in the natural energy field opened with due ceremony at the Sci-Tech Complex on Tuesday. 
					 Taking part in the exhibition, sponsored by the Central Committee of the General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea, are dozens of units including Kim Il Sung University, Kim Chaek University of Technology, the Natural Energy Institute of the State Academy of Sciences, the Electric Power Industry Research Institute of the Ministry of Electric Power Industry and the Pyongyang Mobile Communication Management Bureau.
					
					 On display are more than 1,200 scientific and technological achievements made in developing and using natural energy.
					
					 The exhibition is divided into panels on development and use and saving of natural energy.

articles.title: Russian Embassy Officials Visit KPA Museum of Weapons and Equipment
articles.content:
Russian Embassy Officials Visit KPA Museum of Weapons and Equipment
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Alexandr Matsegora, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of the Russian embassy here Tuesday visited the Museum of Weapons and Equipment of the Korean People's Army on the 15th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's visit to the Far Eastern Region of Russia.
					 Being briefed on the exploits of the peerlessly great men of Mt Paektu for the self-reliant and modern defence industry, the visitors went round various weapons and equipment showing the invincible might of the KPA.

articles.title: Vice-President of ITF on 20th Taekwon-Do World Championships
articles.content:
Vice-President of ITF on 20th Taekwon-Do World Championships
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The 20th Taekwon-Do World Championships is going very well, Leong Wai Meng, vice-president of the International Taekwon-Do Federation, said when interviewed by KCNA on Monday.
					 The opening ceremony was excellent, he said, adding: 
					
					 The Taekwon-Do Hall, the venue of the championships, is well prepared. There are the new scoring equipment and very excellent programs. 
					
					 All these are thanks to the good organizational skill of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee. 
					
					 He said that their stay in Pyongyang is very comfortable and all these are due to the great support of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Delegation of National Tourism Administration Back Home
articles.content:
Delegation of National Tourism Administration Back Home
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the National Tourism Administration of the DPRK led by Director Jo Song Gol returned home Tuesday after taking part in the 22nd Session of the WTO General Assembly in China.

articles.title: Universities Helpful to Developing Economy and Promoting People's Health
articles.content:
Universities Helpful to Developing Economy and Promoting People's Health
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Universities of the DPRK have recently made successes in scientific research, thus contributing to developing the national economy and promoting the people's health.
					 Kim Il Sung University achieved sci-tech successes in putting financial work on an IT-basis including a program for estimating exchange rate.
					
					 Visual electrodiagnostic testing system newly developed by Pyongyang Medical College of Kim Il Sung University proved effective in clinical practice.
					
					 Kim Chaek University of Technology manufactured a device for controlling a main engine of 5 000-ton freight vessel with its own efforts and technology and introduced real-time monitoring system for electric power system and cableway control system into the Masikryong Ski Resort.
					
					 Kim Hyong Jik University of Education settled some technical problems arising in life science field and Phyongsong University of Veterinary Science and Animal Husbandry put feed production and supply and breeding of domestic animals on a higher scientific basis.
					
					 Wonsan University of Medicine intensified a molecular genetic research to put treatment of breast cancer on a scientific basis according to genetic constitution.

articles.title: Paechon Hot Spring in DPRK
articles.content:
Paechon Hot Spring in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- All the mineral waters and hot springs in the DPRK are contributing to promoting the people's health and improving their living standard.
					 Paechon Hot Spring in South Hwanghae Province has long been well-known. It has been registered as state natural monument.
					
					 It contains chlorine, sodium and other ions. Its temperature is 55 to 95 degrees Centigrade and efficacious for dermatitis.
					
					 Paechon County built a hotel to offer conveniences to the visitors. The hotel has 15 hot-spring baths and saunas, table-tennis room, greenhouse, stockbreeding base, restaurant, etc.
					
					 According to Jong Jong Ok, manager of the hotel, it renders all sincerities to visitors from other areas as well as residents in the county in hot-spring treatment.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Ridicules S. Korean Regime for Relying on Sworn Enemy of Nation
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Ridicules S. Korean Regime for Relying on Sworn Enemy of Nation
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet regime is tightening political and military nexus with Japan in response to the measures for bolstering the nuclear force taken by the DPRK for self-defence.
					 Much upset by the consecutive launches of intermediate-range strategic ballistic rocket Hwasong-12 over the Japanese archipelago, the chief executive of south Korea frequently exchanged phone calls with Abe in which he called for "increasing the pressure on the north to the extremes" while expressing "deep sympathy and concern" and talking about an "outrage against a neighboring country".
					
					 At the third East Economic Forum-2017 in Russia some time ago, he held a talk with Abe where he mentioned the urgency of close relations between south Korea and Japan and even let out such rubbish that Japan's past crimes "should never be a stumbling block in improving the bilateral relations."
					
					 It is in the extension of this pursuance to Japan that the abolition of past crimes including the crimes related to the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army were shunned and the validity of an agreement on protecting military intelligence between south Korea and Japan was extended despite the strong protest and denunciation by the public at home and abroad.
					
					 It is nothing surprising that the puppet forces are taking to flunkeyism and treachery to retrieve from its clumsy position strategically inferior to the DPRK.
					
					 Irony is that they are resorting to Japan whose situation is nothing better than them, the island country hardly breathing within the striking range of the nuclear force of the DPRK.
					
					 It seems that the puppet forces do not mind even the sworn enemy to get rid of a pretty fix just like a drowning man catching at a straw.
					
					 The American master whom they relied so much is snubbing them as they fail to play its role, being at a loss how to carry out its north Korea policy.
					
					 Recently the owner of the White House called the Japanese prime minister to discuss the DPRK's measure for bolstering nuclear force, leaving south Korea in the cold. He even posted an article openly criticizing the south Korean chief executive on twitter, bringing shame to him.
					
					 The U.S. is even pushing the puppet forces into a corner, under the pretexts of revision of the south Korea-U.S. "Free Trade Agreement" and THAAD deployment.
					
					 The support rating for the present chief executive of south Korea has been on a rapid decline at a time when it is threatened politically, economically and militarily from neighboring countries due to THAAD.
					
					 The puppet forces have now set aside national sentiment and historical issues and have gone desperate in their moves for political and military nexus with Japan, a poor struggling to get rid of predicament.
					
					 We can never overlook the sinister intention of the puppet forces keen on maintaining the stand-off with the DPRK to the last by stepping up the building of the U.S.-Japan-south Korea triangular military alliance through nexus with Japan.
					
					 The puppet forces are begging for "security" while clinging to outsiders, but it will only aggravate their poor situation.
					
					 The U.S. and Japanese masters are finding it hard to support themselves in the face of the might of the nuclear force of the DPRK that has been remarkably bolstered.
					
					 So miserable is the plight of the puppet forces, unable to find a wall to lean against under the present changed situation.
					
					 The puppet forces have to clearly understand that no masters will risk their lives for stooges.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary on True Colors of An Chol Su
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary on True Colors of An Chol Su
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- An Chol Su, who was recently elected representative of the "Kukmin Party" at its congress, is in tune with the conservative forces, fully taking off the mask of "middle-of-the road politician".
					 He claimed that "the priority task given by the people is to contain arrogance and self-righteousness of the government," calling for directing efforts to holding in check the misbehavior of the government". He hatched a plot with those conservative opposition parties such as "Liberal Korea Party" and "Parun Party" in an attempt to seek "cooperation in parliament" and "policy solidarity".
					
					 He is trying to curry favor with the people in the Honam region by saying that the present government neglects the region at a time when "local self-government election" is set to be held next year. At the same time he openly reveals his intention to keep his remaining days in reliance on the conservative forces, spreading the fiction that solidarity with the “Parun Party” in election and merger of parties would be possible.
					
					 In particular, he branded the ICBM test launch and H-bomb test in the DPRK as "act of those bereft of reason" and "delusion". He joined conservatives in claiming that "south Korea should not beg the north for dialogue but send a resolute and clear message like harsh sanctions based on the alliance with the U.S."
					
					 In this regard, south Korean media, experts and politicians say that An Chol Su betrayed himself and that the "Kukmin Party" is the second company of conservative opposition parties.
					
					 From the very day he went in for politics, south Koreans from different social standings branded him as an unidentified man, greedy power seeker and narrow-minded philistine.
					
					 Under the situation, he is trying to collude with moribund conservatives. This proves that he is a foolish politician and power-seeker without his own views and creed.
					
					 Now the conservative forces are on the verge of destruction with storm in a teacup.
					
					 His is a foolish act to give the conservatives a way to rebirth and betrayal of successes won through candlelight demonstrations.
					
					 The south Korean people keep a watchful eye on An Chol Su and the "Kukmin Party" the approval rate for which is no more than four percent.
					
					 A party forsaken by the people has no value and space to exist.
					
					 It is quite natural that south Koreans from all walks of life including the forces for democracy and reform should keep up vigilance against veer to the right-wing conservatism of the "Kukmin Party," a club of betrayals and a cloud of migratory birds.
					
					 An Chol Su and his clan obsessed with greed for power and partisan interests make no scruple of turning to the conservatives. They will not escape the stern punishment by history and people as the most despicable traitors.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Throwing Overboard Conservative Group in S. Korea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Throwing Overboard Conservative Group in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The miserable end of the Park Geun Hye regime was a stern judgment of the public mind-set on the group of traitors who pushed the inter-Korean relations to the worst catastrophic phase, getting hell-bent the fascist dictatorial rule and irregularities and corruption, backed by outside forces, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an article
					 The conservative group in south Korea are now going reckless to prevent them from meeting the final ruin and prolong their dirty remaining days, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 They raise a hue and cry over "security crisis", malignantly pulling up the DPRK's measures to bolster up the nuclear deterrence for self-defense. This is a revelation of their cynical ploy to take the initiative in the south Korean political landscape and retake the lost position by rallying the conservatives under the cloak of "security".
					
					 Their desperate efforts are an unpardonable action against the aspiration and wishes of the south Korean people for independence, democracy and reunification and against the demand of candlelight holders.
					
					 If the people's vigilance and their fighting spirit are weakened, the group of traitors will raise their heads again, and a new society for the popular masses can be built only through the steady and staunch struggle. This is a lesson taught by the history of the south Korean people's movement.
					
					 For their worthwhile life, the south Korean people should clean sweep away the conservative group which are still going against the trend of the era and the public mind-set though it underwent the stern judgment of history.
					
					 The prevailing situation in south Korea calls for more vigorous struggle against the conservatives seeking revival so that they can never raise their heads again.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slashes Behavior of Representative of "Kukmin Party" of S. Korea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slashes Behavior of Representative of "Kukmin Party" of S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- An Chol Su, representative of "Kukmin Party" of south Korea, blew hot air, saying he would "fight for checking self-importance and arrogance of the ruling forces" soon after his election as chief of the party.
					 He even conspired with the conservative group like "Liberal Korea Party" and "Parun Party" for cooperation in the "National Assembly" and solidarity in policies calling for "rallying forces".
					
					 Commenting on such disgusting behavior, Rodong Sinmun on Tuesday says it is aimed at the elections to the local self-governing bodies to be held next year and is a revelation of his sordid intention to count on even on the collusion with the conservative opposition parties for power.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that An Chol Su, who threw off the mask of "middle of the road" challenging the trend of the times and the candlelight holders, is hurling a flurry of invective for confrontation against the DPRK, in collusion with the conservative group, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 An Chol Su's vociferation together with the conservative group for confrontation with the fellow countrymen cannot go unnoticed. Such reckless behavior is little short of the confrontation moves of the Park Geun Hye group of traitors.
					
					 The carriage of "Kukmin Party" driven by An Chol Su is now approaching the conservative camp closer.
					
					 It is needless to say that the behavior of An and his party will give a chance for the conservative group to save itself from the crisis and bring to naught the successes of candlelight actions.
					
					 The reality requires the pro-democracy and pro-reform forces and people of all strata in south Korea to heighten vigilance against the "Kukmin Party", a club of renegades and a cloud of migratory birds, veering to the right-wing conservatism.

articles.title: DPRK's Step for Bolstering Nuclear Deterrent Is Just: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
DPRK's Step for Bolstering Nuclear Deterrent Is Just: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is beefing up its forces in Asia-Pacific.
					 Recently it forward deployed super-large amphibious craft capable of carrying F-35B Stealth fighters and more than 2 000 marines in its 7th fleet based in Japan.
					
					 Tripoli with a displacement of 45 000 tons has entered into the full-scale preparations for battle. Next spring, amphibious craft Portland will officially be put into commission to go operational in the Pacific.
					
					 The U.S. is also mulling increasing the number of strategic nuclear subs while calling for bolstering the combat capabilities of its navy.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an article says that this is aimed to overwhelm regional rivals with a military edge and thus hold hegemony.
					
					 Remaining unchanged is the U.S. strategy to contain big powers in Asia-Pacific and establish domination in the region, and the U.S. regards it as its priority task to invade the DPRK, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 Peace on the Korean peninsula is related to peace in Northeast Asia and the world.
					
					 Whether a war is averted or not here is a vital issue related to the world peace and the destiny of mankind. The DPRK holds such a heavy mission as it stands in direct confrontation with the U.S., the world's biggest nuclear weapons state.
					
					 It is the invariable stand and goal of the DPRK to ensure peace on the Korean peninsula and Northeast Asia. The only way of realizing this is to contain the U.S. nuclear war moves through powerful war deterrence.
					
					 The situation calls on the DPRK to step up the bolstering of war deterrence.
					
					 The article says that just are the measures for bolstering nuclear deterrence of the DPRK and this can never be subject to any dispute.

articles.title: Minju Joson Blasts S. Korean Regime for Begging for "Sanctions and Pressure on North"
articles.content:
Minju Joson Blasts S. Korean Regime for Begging for "Sanctions and Pressure on North"
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Being thrown into consternation by the complete success in the H-bomb test of the DPRK, the south Korean puppet regime has become zealous in begging for "harshest sanctions and pressure on the north".
					 Commenting on the fact, Minju Joson Tuesday says:
					
					 Such bagging for "harshest sanctions and pressure" is an intolerable traitorous act of those ignorant of what the valuable treasure of the nation is, who the true principal enemy of the nation is and what guarantees the peace of the Korean peninsula and national prosperity.
					
					 This disgusting behavior only reveals the despicable pro-U.S. sycophantic nature of the puppet regime only keen on realizing the ambition for escalating confrontation with the fellow countrymen in reliance on outsiders.
					
					 The decades-old nuclear war threats posed to the DPRK by the U.S. have awakened the Korean people and furthered the justifications for having access to nuclear weapons.
					
					 However, the puppet forces are trying to bring the DPRK into submission through the worn-out racket for begging for "sanctions and pressure". It is the height of folly. This proves to the world that the present south Korean authorities are nothing different from the Lee Myung Bak and Park Geun Hye regimes which had been keen on dependence on outsiders and confrontation with the fellow countrymen, while failing to discern who the true principal enemy of the nation is.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities truly wish for the improvement of the north-south relations, they should not go silly as resorting to the racket of begging for "sanctions and pressure" to stifle the fellow countrymen but come to their senses, away from the sycophancy toward the U.S. and the awareness of confrontation with the fellow countrymen, and do things beneficial to the improvement of the north-south relations, from the stand of national independence.

articles.title: Sanctions Will Change Nothing: Minju Joson
articles.content:
Sanctions Will Change Nothing: Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- A commentary of Minju Joson Tuesday censures the fabrication of "sanctions resolution" 2375 against the DPRK by the U.S. and its vassal forces as the silly act of those bereft of mental composure and ability to discern what catastrophic consequences their criminal acts will entail.
					 It goes on:
					
					 Truly disgusting and what's more ridiculous is the malicious behavior of the U.S. staking its fate on the threadbare farce of the sanctions even though it is quite well aware that the sanctions will bring it nothing.
					
					 The U.S. racket of sanctions and pressure on the DPRK has only hardened the will of the Korean army and people to annihilate the enemies and resulted in making them open up the way to a charge with the sledge-hammer of self-reliance.
					
					 Clear is the aim sought by the U.S. in clinging to the racket of sanctions against the DPRK.
					
					 It is to stamp out the DPRK's sovereignty and rights to existence and development and thus realize at any cost the ambition for bringing down it.
					
					 There is no other option for the DPRK as the U.S. is working with bloodshot eyes to undermine the ideology of the DPRK and bring down its social system by brandishing the sanctions stick.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will as in the past hold tightly the treasured sword of the simultaneous development of the two fronts and dash toward the final victory and foil the U.S. and other hostile forces' anti-DPRK moves.
					
					 The U.S. sanctions on the DPRK will prove futile and it will be just like sweeping the sea with broom.

articles.title: U.S. Conducts Joint Drills with S. Korea, Japan
articles.content:
U.S. Conducts Joint Drills with S. Korea, Japan
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Two B-1B nuclear strategic bombers and four F-35B stealth fighters of the U.S. took off Guam to carry out a bomb dropping drill with fighters of the south Korean air force in the sky above south Korea on Monday, according to reports.
					 Earlier, those U.S. warplanes conducted a joint drill with fighters of Japan's "Self-Defense Forces" in the sky above Kyushu.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers' Missile Launch Failed
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers' Missile Launch Failed
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- A Hyonmu ground-to-ground missile launched by the warmongers of south Korea on September 15 fell to the sea after flying for some seconds, according to south Korean KBS.
					 The puppet military is busy explaining the cause of the failure, retrieving the missile from the waters and verifying the performance of the missiles in the same series.
					
					 This kind of fallen missile is core element of the "Kill Chain" to be used for mounting a preemptive attack on the DPRK "in contingency".

articles.title: DPRK's Founding Anniversary Marked Syrian Media
articles.content:
DPRK's Founding Anniversary Marked Syrian Media
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Syrian media dedicated special write-ups to the 69th founding anniversary of the DPRK on September 7 and 9.
					 The Syria TV Channel carried portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and photos showing their undying exploits and the revolutionary activities of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 It introduced the successes registered by the army and people of the DPRK in building a socialist power and praised the might of socialist Korea displaying its dignity as the nuclear weapons state of Juche and ICBM possessor.
					
					 Radio Syria aired a special report about the fact that the DPRK has covered the road of victory and honor under the guidance of the peerlessly great men of Mt Paektu for nearly seven decades since its foundation.
					
					 The Syrian Arab News Agency introduced in detail the advantages of Korean-style socialism centered on the popular masses.
					
					 The newspaper al-Watan said that the foundation and history of development of the DPRK would not have been unthinkable without the nation-building exploits of the President.
					
					 Newspaper Tishrin said that Kim Il Sung's cause of nation-building is creditably carried forward by respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Newspaper Al Baath noted that the DPRK has made world-startling miracles and innovations in the face of all sorts of moves of the hostile forces led by the U.S. over the past 69 years.
					
					 Newspaper Al Thawrah said that 69 years of the DPRK is a history of victory and honor and the DPRK has developed into an invincible socialist state and that the Korean people are convinced of their final victory.

articles.title: DPRK's Successful H-bomb Test Hailed in Nigeria
articles.content:
DPRK's Successful H-bomb Test Hailed in Nigeria
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Nigerian political party and organization issued statements on September 4 and 5 hailing the DPRK's successful ICBM-ready H-bomb test.
					 The People's Progressive Party of Nigeria said in its statement that the successful H-bomb test was a brilliant victory of the Korean people who have consistently implemented the line of simultaneously pushing forward the economic construction and the building of nuclear force without any vacillation despite the U.S. and hostile forces' outrageous and barbarous anti-DPRK moves and a demonstration of the DPRK's comprehensive nuclear force.
					
					 The recent special event proved once again that no force can stop the Korean people dynamically advancing along the road of independence, Songun and socialism, united close around respected Supreme Leader Marshal Kim Jong Un, the statement stressed.
					
					 It appealed to the world progressives to lift up their voice of supporting the principled stand and efforts of the Korean people for peace and stability on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association said in its statement that the H-bomb test was an auspicious event common to the Korean people and the world progressives loving peace and aspiring after truth.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 All the DPRK's measures for self-defence including H-bomb test can never be a threat to world peace as they are an exercise of just and legitimate right of a sovereign state for defending its sovereignty and rights to existence and development.
					
					 We extend firm solidarity to the Korean people's just struggle, fully supporting the DPRK's recent successful H-bomb test.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita Fiesta Nacional de Nepal
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita Fiesta Nacional de Nepal
Pyongyang, 19 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 19 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica Democratica Federal de Nepal, Bidhya Devi Bhandari en ocasion del Dia Nacional de este pais.
					  Convencido de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion existentes entre ambos paises se ampliaran y se desarrollaran aun mas en varias ramas, el remitente desea de todo corazon los exitos en las labores del destinatario y el pueblo nepales.

articles.title: Delegacion de RPDC parte de Pyongyang para participar en reunion de la ONU
articles.content:
Delegacion de RPDC parte de Pyongyang para participar en reunion de la ONU
Pyongyang, 19 de septiembre (ACNC) -- La delegacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, encabezada por el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores, Ri Yong Ho, partio el dia 19 de esta capital para participar en la 72a sesion de la Asamblea General de la ONU.

articles.title: Embajador cubano ofrece banquete
articles.content:
Embajador cubano ofrece banquete 
Pyongyang, 19 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El embajador cubano en Corea Jesus De Los Angeles Aise Sotolongo ofrecio el dia 19 un banquete en su sede diplomatica en homenaje al 69o aniversario de la fundacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea. 
					Fueron invitados el vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, Kim Yong Dae, el presidente del Comite de Educacion y del Comite Coreano de Solidaridad con Cuba, Kim Sung Du, la presidenta del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero, Kim Jong Suk, y los funcionarios interesados.
					
					En su discurso pronunciado en la ocasion, el embajador cubano dijo que bajo la audaz y probada orientacion del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un, la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea exalta su poderio como pais socialista en prosperidad. 
					
					Destaco que pese a la injusta sancion del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU, se van mejorando cada dia mas las condiciones de vida del pueblo coreano, y afirmo que Cuba estara al lado de Corea y apoyara siempre la justa causa del pueblo coreano, aunque se interpongan las pruebas y dificultades de toda indole. 
					
					Kim Yong Dae dijo en su discurso que en el tiempo pasado los pueblos de los dos paises vinieron apoyandose y cooperando estrechamente en la lucha conjunta contra EE.UU. y el imperialismo y por el socialismo y creando la historia de amistad mas sincera y solida.
					
					Enfatizo que en el futuro tambien el pueblo coreano manifestara el apoyo total y solidaridad a la lucha del hermano pueblo cubano por defender con firmeza las conquistas del socialismo frustrando las brutales maniobras anticubanas de EE.UU. y materializar estrictamente la resolucion del VII Congreso del Partido.

articles.title: Se inaugurara XIII Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias Otonal de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Se inaugurara XIII Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias Otonal de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 19 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tendra lugar del dia 25 al 28 en la Exposicion Permanente de las Tres Revoluciones la XIII Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias Otonal de Pyongyang.
					  En esta edicion tomaran parte mas de 250 companias de varios paises y regiones del mundo, tales como la RPDC, Siria, China, Cuba, Iran, Italia, Indonesia, Vietnam y Taipei China.
					
					  Se mostraran los articulos electronicos, maquinas, materiales de construccion, productos de transporte, medicina, industria ligera, alimentos y articulos de uso diario, hechos con ciencias y tecnologias de punta.
					
					La feria contribuira a promover la amistad, el intercambio y la cooperacion economica entre varios paises.

articles.title: Efectuada segunda jornada del XX Campeonato Mundial de Taekwon-do
articles.content:
Efectuada segunda jornada del XX Campeonato Mundial de Taekwon-do
Pyongyang, 19 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Continua en el Palacio de Taekwon-do el XX Campeonato Mundial de Taekwon-do.
					Se efectuaron el dia 19 el parrins individual de ambos sexos por categoria de distintos pesos y la competencia de tecnica especial.
					
					Desde su inicio, el parrins, disciplina mas popular de Taekwondo, atrajo la atencion de los visitantes.
					
					En las competencias, los taekwondocas mostraron sin reserva diversas tecnicas y el poderio de Taekwondo y sus nobles cualidades espirituales y morales.
					
					Continua el campeonato.
					
					Los resultados de la primera jornada efectuada el dia 18 van como sigue:
					
					
					
					Pattern individual (m) del primer grado
					
					1o lugar: Han Hyok Bom (RPDC)
					
					2o lugar: Rim Wi Sok (RPDC)
					
					3o lugar: Aleksandr Bodrov (Rusia), Vladislav Zarov (Estonia)
					
					
					
					El del segundo grado
					
					1o lugar: Kim Chol Hak (RPDC)
					
					2o lugar: Kim Kwang Chon (RPDC)
					
					3o lugar: Lyubomir Bakalski (Bulgaria), Stanislav Usikov (Rusia)
					
					
					
					El del tercer grado
					
					1o lugar: Han Tae Bom (RPDC)
					
					2o lugar: Ivan Efimov (Rusia)
					
					3o lugar: Sergei Shcherbenev (Rusia), Wang Chao (China)
					
					
					
					El del cuarto grado
					
					1o lugar: Kim Nam Su (RPDC)
					
					2o lugar: Pal Chivorn (Camboya)
					
					3o lugar: Shen Zhenzhe (China), Miljan Cosic (Bosnia-Herzegovina)
					
					
					
					Pattern individual (f) del primer grado
					
					1o lugar: Yuliya Sredniakova (Rusia)
					
					2o lugar: Pae Kyong Sim (RPDC)
					
					3o lugar: Tong Jing (China), Pravdova Kristyna (Checo)
					
					
					
					El del segundo grado
					
					1o lugar: Ri Un Jong (RPDC)
					
					2o lugar: Zhang Lele (China)
					
					3o lugar: Charlotte Jayne Nickson (Pais de Gales), Olga Borisenko (Estonia)
					
					
					
					El del tercer grado
					
					1o lugar: Kim Hyang Sim (RPDC)
					
					2o lugar: Anna Tishchenko (Rusia)
					
					3o lugar: Kopecka Martina (Checo), Valentina Iotchkova (Inglaterra)
					
					
					
					El del cuarto grado
					
					1o lugar: Kim Ji Hyang (RPDC)
					
					2o lugar: Jenine Hutchinson (Inglaterra)
					
					3o lugar: Maria Klochkova (Rusia), Albena Sitnilska (Bulgaria)
					
					
					
					Pattern colectivo masculino
					
					1o lugar: RPDC
					
					2o lugar: Rusia
					
					3o lugar: Ucrania, la India
					
					
					
					Pattern colectivo femenino
					
					1o lugar: RPDC
					
					2o lugar: Rusia
					
					3o lugar: Checo, China
